alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 7:09AM CDT until August 02 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN HARRISON AND SOUTHERN BURT COUNTIES... At 709 AM CDT, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Tekamah. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tekamah, Oakland, Craig, Summit Lake State Recreation Area and Pelican Point State Recreation Area. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
